Reference¶

Session parameters¶

Various operations can be performed against the DataONE infrastructure via the DataONE Command Line Interface (CLI). The operations obtain the parameters they require from a set of shared, configurable, values called session parameters.

Startup¶

When the CLI starts, it attempts to load the session parameters from a configuration file named .d1client.conf, located in the user’s home directory. If the configuration file is not present, the session parameters are set to default values as shown in the Default column in the overview of session parameters.

The CLI then executes any commands specified on the command line, in the specified order. This includes any set commands that modify the session parameters.

Command line arguments¶

One or more commands may be specified on the command line. The CLI will execute these before entering interactive mode. The CLI can be prevented from entering interactive mode by adding the exit command to the end of the list of commands.

E.g., the following command will start the CLI, execute a list command based on any default values in the .d1client.conf file and then exit.

$ dataone.py list exit

Commands that contain spaces or other symbols that have specific meaning to the shell must be quoted with single quotes:

$ dataone.py 'get mypid myfile'

The session parameters available in interactive mode can be modified on startup by specifying set commands. E.g., the following is the same as first running dataone.py and then typing the two commands, set start 100 and set count 10:

$ dataone.py 'set start 100' 'set count 10'

Commands¶

<...> denotes required arguments.

[...] denotes optional arguments.

file is the filesystem path to a local file.

Commands are case sensitive.

  • CLI
    • history
    • exit
    • help
    • Verbose
    • XML formatting
  • Session parameters
    • reset
    • load [file]
    • save [file]
    • get [session parameter]
    • set <session parameter> <value>
    • clear <session parameter>
  • Access Policy
    • allow <subject> [access level]
    • deny <subject>
    • allowpublic
    • denypublic
    • denyall
  • Replication Policy
    • clearreplication
    • addpreferred <member node>
    • addblocked <member node>
    • remove <member node>
    • allowreplication
    • disallowreplication
    • setreplicas <number of replicas>
  • Authentication
  • Searching
    • search
    • fields
  • Science Object Operations
    • data <pid> <file>
    • meta <pid> [file]
    • create <pid> <file>
    • related <pid>
    • resolve <pid>
    • list
    • log
    • setaccess <pid>
    • setreplication <pid>
